skill.name: mermaid-diagrams
skill.description: Comprehensive guide for creating software diagrams using Mermaid syntax. Use when users need to create, visualize, or document software through diagrams including class diagrams (domain modeling, object-oriented design), sequence diagrams (application flows, API interactions, code execution), flowcharts (processes, algorithms, user journeys), entity relationship diagrams (database schemas), C4 architecture diagrams (system context, containers, components), state diagrams, git graphs, pie charts, gantt charts, or any other diagram type. Triggers include requests to "diagram", "visualize", "model", "map out", "show the flow", or when explaining system architecture, database design, code structure, or user/application flows.
skill.summary: Generate professional software diagrams using text-based Mermaid syntax for documentation.
skill.author: softaworks

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing markdown files with Mermaid syntax examples. All static findings are false positives from the scanner misinterpreting markdown code blocks, example text, and documentation references. No scripts, executable code, network calls, or command execution exist in this skill.

content.value_statement: Users struggle to create professional software diagrams that are version-controllable and easy to maintain. This skill provides comprehensive guidance for creating diagrams using Mermaid's text-based syntax, making diagram creation accessible and manageable alongside code.
actual_capabilities: Generate class diagrams for domain modeling and object-oriented design
Create sequence diagrams for API flows, authentication, and system interactions
Build flowcharts for user journeys, processes, and decision logic
Design entity relationship diagrams for database schemas
Construct C4 architecture diagrams for system documentation
Apply themes, styling, and configuration to customize diagram appearance
limitations: Does not execute or render diagrams directly - outputs Mermaid syntax for external rendering
Cannot create complex mathematical graphs or specialized chart types beyond basic pie/bar charts
Relies on external tools like Mermaid Live Editor for final rendering and export
Does not provide real-time collaboration features

use_cases.title: Document software architecture
use_cases.description: Create C4 diagrams to document system context, containers, components, and code-level relationships for technical documentation and stakeholder communication.

use_cases.title: Visualize API interactions
use_cases.description: Generate sequence diagrams showing request/response flows, authentication sequences, and service-to-service communication patterns.

use_cases.title: Design database schemas
use_cases.description: Build entity relationship diagrams to model tables, keys, and cardinality for database design and documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Basic diagram request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Mermaid class diagram showing the relationship between {entity1} and {entity2}. Include attributes and methods for each class.
prompt_templates.scenario: When a user asks to diagram a class structure

prompt_templates.title: API flow diagram
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a Mermaid sequence diagram for a {action} flow involving {participants}. Show authentication, data transfer, and response handling.
prompt_templates.scenario: When documenting API or user interaction flows

prompt_templates.title: Architecture documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a C4 {level} diagram for a {system_type} showing {components} and their relationships. Include external users and dependencies.

prompt_templates.title: Database schema design
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a Mermaid ERD for a {domain} domain with {entities} entities. Include primary keys, foreign keys, and cardinality indicators.
prompt_templates.scenario: When designing or documenting database schemas

output_examples.input: Create a class diagram for a library system with Book, Author, and Member classes
Show a user login and data retrieval sequence
Design an ERD for an e-commerce system

best_practices: Use consistent naming conventions and clear labels to make diagrams self-documenting
Start with core entities and add details incrementally to avoid overcomplexity
Store Mermaid files (.mmd) alongside code in version control for easy updates
anti_patterns: Including too many details in a single diagram - split complex diagrams into focused views
Using unclear or ambiguous labels that require explanation outside the diagram
Failing to update diagrams when code structure changes, leading to documentation drift

faq.question: How do I render Mermaid diagrams?
faq.answer: Mermaid diagrams render automatically in GitHub, GitLab, and many markdown editors. For other platforms, use the Mermaid Live Editor (mermaid.live) or the Mermaid CLI tool.

faq.question: Can I use Mermaid in VS Code?
faq.answer: Yes, install the Markdown Mermaid extension for VS Code to preview diagrams while editing markdown files.

faq.question: What diagram types are supported?
faq.answer: Mermaid supports class, sequence, flowchart, state, entity relationship, gantt, pie, git graph, and C4 diagrams.

faq.question: How do I style my diagrams?
faq.answer: Use the config frontmatter to apply themes (default, forest, dark, neutral, base) and customize colors, fonts, and shapes.

faq.question: Can I export diagrams as images?
faq.answer: Yes, use the Mermaid CLI to export as PNG or SVG: mmdc -i input.mmd -o output.png

faq.question: How do I handle complex layouts?
faq.answer: Use subgraphs to group related nodes and the elk layout option for advanced positioning of complex diagrams.
